definition: Zengzi (505-435 BC), student of Confucius, presumed editor or author of Confucian classic the Great Learning 大學|大学[Da4 xue2]
great- (grandfather, grandchild etc)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
surname Zeng
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: With that Zengziwent to slaughter the pig and prepare a good meal for their son.
sentences.chinese: 于是曾子就杀猪煮肉给孩子吃。

sentences.english: Zengzi's wife was going to the market. Her little son insisted on going with her, making a tearful scene.
sentences.chinese: 曾子的妻子到集市上去，他的儿子哭着要跟去。

sentences.english: Zengzi's wife was going to the market.
sentences.chinese: 曾子的妻子到集市上去。

sentences.english: Engzi's wife go, his son followed after crying to go.
sentences.chinese: 曾子的妻子上街去，他的儿子跟在后面哭着要去。

sentences.english: Zeng and his wife listened to his son's words, are happy to laughed.
sentences.chinese: 曾子和妻子听了儿子的这番话，都开心地笑了。

sentences.english: One day, Zeng Zi's wife wanted to go to market.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，曾子的妻子要上街。

sentences.english: When she came back, Zengzi got ready to slaughter the pig.
sentences.chinese: 她刚从集市上回来，曾子就要捉猪去。

sentences.english: Zeng Zi was one of Confucius' disciples.
sentences.chinese: 曾子是孔子的一个学生。

definition: Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Mencius 孟子 (c. 372-c. 289), Confucian philosopher
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
the Sage Confucius
Confucius
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Zai Yu (522-458 BC), disciple of Confucius
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Zuo Qiuming or Zuoqiu Ming (556-451), famous blind historian from Lu 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2] to whom the history Zuo Zhuan 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4] is attributed
